definition[0]: if animals breed, they mate in order to have babies
example[0]: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
definition[1]: to keep animals or plants in order to produce babies or new plants, especially ones with particular qualities
example[1]: These dogs were originally bred in Scotland to round up sheep.
definition[2]: to cause a particular feeling or condition
example[2]: Poor living conditions breed violence and despair.
definition[3]: if a place, situation, or thing breeds a particular type of person, it produces that type
example[3]: Societyâ€™s obsession with sex has bred a generation of unhappy children.
definition[4]: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
example[4]: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
definition[5]: a particular kind of person or type of thing
example[5]: Real cowboys are a dying breed  (=not many exist anymore).
example[6]: Dodd was one of that rare breed  (=there are not many of them) who could make the game of football look simple.
example[7]: a new breed of international criminal
